title: ECHOES Focus Group on Intangible Heritage Communities
content:
ECHOES Focus Group on Intangible Heritage Communities

The ECHOES project organised a virtual Focus Group on Intangible Cultural Heritage Institutions in collaboration with CLARIN on 19 January 2026.   
After a brief introduction to the Cultural Heritage Cloud by Rémi Petitcol, as well as CLARIN’s work on Intangible Cultural Heritage by Francesca Frontini, the session featured two keynote presentations: 

  • Insights from the PlaceMUS XR project, which develops digital tools
creator: Elisa Gorgaini
sourceDescription: Common Language Resources and Technology Infrastructure

title: Parliamentary Speech Analysis with ParlaMint
content:
Parliamentary Speech Analysis with ParlaMint

GitHub repository with multiple tutorials for analyzing parliamentary speeches across multiple European countries. The 5 tutorial notebooks combine processing of ParlaMint data, sentiment analysis, party comparisons and cross-country analyses which enable students and researchers to study the tone and content of parliamentary debates systematically.

Main author of the tutorials: Isabell Furkert

This work is supported by the OSCARS project
creator: Iulianna van der Lek-Ciudin
sourceDescription: Common Language Resources and Technology Infrastructure

title: Experimental and Usage-based Approaches to Language and the Role of Research Infrastructures
content:
Experimental and Usage-based Approaches to Language and the Role of Research Infrastructures

creator: Iulianna van der Lek-Ciudin
sourceDescription: Common Language Resources and Technology Infrastructure

title: CLARIN Newsflash January 2026 is Out
content:
CLARIN Newsflash January 2026 is Out

Every month the Newsflash gives an overview of what has been happening at the CLARIN, the national consortia and the wider community. The newsflash also features events, calls and vacancies that are relevant for the CLARIN community.
creator: Elisa Gorgaini
sourceDescription: Common Language Resources and Technology Infrastructure

title: Centre news vol. 77 - January 2026
content:
Centre news vol. 77 - January 2026

Support Text and Data Mining

Votes in the European Parliament are coming up with a risk of rendering the Text and Data Mining exception meaningless, threatening the training and use of Large Language Models.

Please be invited to express your concerns by
creator: Dieter Van Uytvanck
sourceDescription: Common Language Resources and Technology Infrastructure

title: Virtual Collection Registry (VCR)
content:
Virtual Collection Registry (VCR)

This presentation shows how to create a citable collection of language resources with the CLARIN Virtual Collection Registry.

A virtual collection is a coherent set of links to digital objects (e.g. annotated text, video) that can be easily created, accessed and cited. The links can originate from different archives. A virtual collection is suitable for manual access (using a web-browser) as well a
creator: Thalassia Kontino
sourceDescription: Common Language Resources and Technology Infrastructure

title: Resources for Language Documentation and Archiving
content:
Resources for Language Documentation and Archiving

This catalogue entry points to a collection of comprehensive tutorials developed by Endangered Languages Archives (ELAR) to support language documenters and ELAR depositors. The resources include PDF guides and video tutorials as well as useful files like templates and scripts. These materials are designed to help support language documentation projects at every stage, from data preparation tasks like file conversion and transcription, to metadata creation, to uploading to the archive and editing existing me
creator: Iulianna van der Lek-Ciudin
sourceDescription: Common Language Resources and Technology Infrastructure
